results.title: The Importance of food safety
results.brief_description: This video is about how to safely handle and prepare food for public consumption. It is aimed at people who prepare food in the hospitality industry and other food handling professions, but contains useful tips to keep in mind when preparing food in the home. Discusses bacteria and how to lessen its effects, storage temperatures and conditions for food, both raw and cooked, freezing, thawing and cooking of food, delivery of food and how to lessen the likelihood of illness from improperly prepared food. Includes a questionnaire to test knowledge of content of video.

results.title: The Impersonation
results.brief_description: Since it first became known in 1974, the signature of the contemporary English ‘primitive’ painter, Reginald Pepper, has been gaining prominence amongst critics and collectors. It now appears that such a painter does not exist. This film presents an overview of the case of Reginald Pepper and also looks at the broader issues concerning ‘primitivism’ in art.

results.title: The Impact of the Second World War on Indonesian nationalism
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “War and society”.
The film shows how the Japanese encouraged Indonesian nationalism under the Japanese scheme for Greater Asia. Introduced by Donald Watt.

results.title: The Immigrant
results.creator_credit: Blackhawk Films and Van Beuren Corporation
results.brief_description: On their way to America, Charlie befriends a girl and her mother after an incident aboard ship. Later ashore they become involved in one of the funniest restaurant sequences ever filmed. One of the top Chaplin comedies of the mutual period. Cast also includes Edna Purviance, Eric Campbell, Albert Austin, Henry Bergman.

results.title: The Image
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Exploring Photography”.
One of a series aimed to improve the viewer’s understanding of “the image” in photography as a creative medium and to increase their awareness of the options. Several photographers discuss their work.

results.title: The Illustrated Auschwitz
results.creator_credit: Jackie Farkas, Lucia Salinas Briones and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The voice of an Auschwitz survivor (voice provided by Zsuzsi Weinstock) is presented against a backdrop of images, both hopeful and tragic. She speaks of her childhood impressions, of a belief that she couldn’t avoid her fate and the impact of Hitler’s voice. Footage from “The Wizard of Oz” is juxtaposed against images of haystacks and has a personal significance to the narrator who wished she could go ‘home’, but realises she has none to go to.

results.title: The Hunger machine. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Ian McFarlane, Chris Bryer and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Politics of food”.
Feeding the hungry of the world is not just an exercise in good agricultural practices or a result of foreign aid and trade. Governments can affect farmers by imposing tarrifs or providing subsidies so that even in times of surplus, the needy may be disadvantaged. More productive agricultural programmes can increase food supply, however in developing countries who receive aid and food, the incentive to develop these practices may not be encouraged by the political forces in power.

results.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame (Disney)
results.creator_credit: Gary Trousdale, Kirk Wise, Don Hahn and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Animated musical Disney version of Victor Hugo’s gothic novel “The Hunchback of Notre Dame.” Quasimodo is a hunchback who was rescued by a kindly priest, just as he was to be cast down a well. Now an adult, Quasimodo is employed as bell ringer at the monastery, but is an outcast and a prisoner in his bell tower, by order of his master Judge Frollo. During a carnival, Quasimodo is taunted by the merciless crowd and about to be flogged when a beautiful and spirited gypsy woman named Esmeralda intervenes. Frollo, a treacherous man who loathes gypsies, falls in lust with Esmeralda, who enrages him further by spurning his advances and mocking him. Esmeralda meanwhile has fallen for the handsome Phoebus, despite feeling compassion for the brutalised Quasimodo. Unlike other Disney productions, “The Hunchback of Notre Dame” entertains darker themes of racism, desire and rebellion, and the animation matches the sinister undercurrents of the book. The animation is impressive, (at times recalling “Fantasia”) as is the voice work of Tom Hulce, Demi Moore and Kevin Kline. Deviating from the original novel, comic relief is provided in the order of numerous gargoyles that befriend Quasimodo.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gary Trousdale, Kirk Wise, Don Hahn and Walt Disney Pictures

results.title: The Hume highway
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the road link between Melbourne and Sydney, showing the many places of interest along the Hume Highway. Describes the early explorations of Hume and Hovell in 1824; the founding of Melbourne in 1835; travel by coach in the gold rush days; the building of the first railway lines; the introduction of the first internal combustion engines leading to a great increase in mechanical road transportation and the building of the Hume Highway. The latter part of the film shows various places of interest along the Highway between Melbourne and Albury. Commentary by Walter Pym. Photography by J. B. Stirling.
